review.title: It's a bed and it's near the freeway
review.reviewText:
If all you need is a bed and a shower it's fine. 
No facilities to get a hot drink in room or hotel so if after lunch when you arrive (which it was for us) you would have to drive to get one! 
Wifi was paid per device so expensive and there was no hairdryer.

review.title: Not a great place to stay.
review.reviewText:
- Air conditioning didn't work.
- Food was still in the refrigerator from the previous person.
- Coffee grounds still in coffee maker from last person.
- We think there was blood in the bathtub, up high.  Didn't touch.  
- Elevator hadn't been cleaned or mopped in weeks.
- Hallways were dirty.

We got in late, so tired, didn't have the strength to deal with changing to a different hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Please see above for needing improvements
review.locationRemarks: Restaurant next door served a decent breakfast.

review.title: Nice Motel
review.reviewText: The only little problem is that bed is not the best.
review.negativeRemarks: Bed
review.locationRemarks: Nice location

review.title: Awful.
review.reviewText: No internet. No clock. No hairdryer. No iron. Stained bedspread. Pot smokers in many of the rooms. Scary neighborhood. Friendly staff.

review.title: TERRIBLE HOTEL , VERY BAD
review.reviewText:
MI LITTLE GIRLS , 4 YEAR OLDS. 
 A SYRINGE BONDING IN FURNITURE , I HAVE ADVISED THE STAFF , IT PUT 30 MINUTE TO COME SEE , VERY BAD SERVICE, IS DANGEROUS FOR MI GIRLS
I OFTEN SLEEPING IN MOTEL 6 C BUT IS THE FIRST TIME THAT PASS ME


I AM STAY 2 NIGHT , THEROOM  WAS NEVER cleaning 
I AM REALLY DISAPPOINTED OF THIS HOTEL .

review.title: Bad hotel, very dirty.
review.reviewText: I had a layover in San Francisco and reached out to Expedia for a hotel, found this one and made the big mistake of assuming that Expedia inspects hotels prior to offering them on their website. I have learned the hard way that I was way wrong because this hotel is a very bad hotel, very dirty room, carpet, walls, bed, bathroom. Even the hallway was filthy and the entire place had an aweful smell.

review.title: Nice, clean, Huge room. Very roomy, updated, quiet
review.reviewText: Nice stay. Room was great. Clean, spacious and comfty

review.title: Like a dorm room
review.reviewText: Staying at this hotel felt like I was staying in a dorm room. The bed was comfortable but that was the extent. There was no carpet on the floor, no rugs, no shampoo or conditioner for the shower, and no clock. It was just weird. I had to call maintenance when I first arrived because the air conditioner was not working. The person who checked me in was not friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: The bed was comfortable and the location was good. It was right off the freeway and easy to find.
review.negativeRemarks: Rugs on the floor by the bed, a clock and maybe some complementary shampoo and conditioner.
review.locationRemarks: The location is right off the freeway. Downtown San Francisco is only half an hour drive.

review.reviewText: Comfortable and clean! Very spacious rooms. Would recommend to stay here.

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: Housekeeping knocked and woke us every morning at 930ish. No tag to put our on the door to not bother us. Never came back to make beds or replace towels. We reused our bath towels and intended too, but clean hand towels and wash clothes would've been nice. Called the front desk when we returned to our room, asking for clean ones, and was told we needed to come to the front desk to get more. The pool and outside furniture was absolutely filthy. My son swam for about 20 minutes and refused to get back in because of it. We were in CA for 9 days and the 3 days we spent there, were the only days he didn't swim, other than the 20 minutes. However, lobby staff was extremely polite and efficient with check in and being so close to the airport was nice.
No frills except a pool. Kinda close to san francisco. Staff was ok, didnt interact much with them. Kinda smelly in our room, but I think it's because it's a pet friendly hotel.
Too noisy to fall asleep, some kind of machine operating sounds all night long
Good location...overall it's not a bad place to stay.
Very good. I really enjoyed my experience at Motel 6

review.title: Very good for the price
review.reviewText: Good place to stay the night if you are visiting. About 25 minutes from downtown SF with out traffic.

review.title: Just ok
review.reviewText: Room is big but the shower sink water can't get away and toilet is always smell bad and too much noise at night

review.title: for the price you get good value.
review.reviewText: A very convenient location and well lit.  Staff is friendly and room is spacious but not fancy.  You get good value for the price paid.
The room was clean and orderly. Nothing elaborate, but comfortable.

review.title: Great clean Motel 6
review.reviewText: Best budget motel in SFO area. My stay here was pleasant. My room was very clean and large. I had a full size fridge and kitchenette. Pet friendly. The manager was fabulous. I could tell he really cared about making everyone's stay enjoyable and I overheard him motivating staff. Job well done.

review.title: Cigerette ash in the towel holders
review.reviewText: I was disgusted to find cigarette ash on the towel ashes after I had used the towels...this should be a simple part of the cleaning routine everytime. Hotel staff was young and inexperienced. I had to carry full size ironing board up to my room, two flights by myself.

review.title: Poor Quality Hotel
review.reviewText: Checked in and had requested a room with two beds.  Not only did the girl at the front desk have difficulty speaking and understanding English, she was very rude, and refused to help me with my request.  They say the rooms have been renovated, but really they have just been painted and replaced carpet with fake wood flooring.  There are zero amenities, no hangars to hang clothes on, no soap,or shampoo offered in the bathroom, I'm actually surprised they had toilet paper. Overall very uncomfortable, and unpleasant stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Customer service, as well as the overall quality of the hotel.

review.reviewText: Basic hotel but clean and a good bed.

review.title: Okay.
review.reviewText: My sheets seemed like they were not changed. There was a cigarette burn on my sheet and a few strands of hair. Which was longer than mines. My head is shaved, therefore, I am absolutely sure that it was my hair. I would not go back to this hotel nor would I recommend it to any of my friends or family.

review.title: Nice hotel close to the beach
review.reviewText: Good experience. My overall rating is yellows not red as inadvertently shown.

review.title: Filthy Motel 6 in Belmont, CA.
review.reviewText: The Manager Art was extremely rude and kept bragging that he was a cop for 15 years. Grounds and pool were disgusting. Rooms were minimal, even for a Motel 6, one wash cloth for two guests.

review.title: The Motel 6 is in terrible condition.
review.reviewText: Filthy exterior inclunding buildings, grounds, pool. Manager, Art was extremely rude. Desk staff had inefficient equipment, the key machine did not work; told us to use a.Post-It note instead of giving us a "Do Not Disturb" hanger. Undesirables were walking around, very uncomfortable for Motel guests.

review.title: Location was ok, close to freeway
review.reviewText:
The owner refused to give senior discount, refused to honor reservation for 2, then charged for extra person. Even when I was forced to stay a second night, he again would not give a senior discount and again charged for an extra person, even though my original reservation called for two beds, which were provided with original reservation. He kept saying, "you can only have one person but you get two beds. Any more people, you pay extra. And no senior discount, even though you are a senior citizen."
When I came in the lobby in the morning for coffee, he jumped in front of me, pushing me out of the way so he could get his coffee first.
The rooms were dirty, I wore white socks and the soles of the socks were filthy in five minutes. The night stand was sticky and the bathroom was no better. The housecleaner's carts don't carry wet mops, so I don't blame the housecleaners. They aren't given enough time to properly clean the rooms. I left a generous tip because I feel sorry for them, working for that owner.
I will never stay there again.
review.positiveRemarks: The maids seemed nice and the location was good.
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms need a thorough cleaning. The owner needs some soft skills and needs to be schooled in treating customers well.
review.locationRemarks: I was there on business.

review.title: Very average
review.reviewText: The motel was comfy but not well equipped at all. We stayed in two rooms with kitchenettes but there was very little kitchen equipment and in one of the rooms the fridge was broken. You also have to pay for wifi at $2.99 for 24 hours per device.

review.title: This place sucks
review.reviewText:
1.  No bathtub plug so forget bathing.
2.  No luggage carts so enjoy hauling.
3.  No dinner nearby so enjoy starving.
4.  Elevator vibrates room so forget sleeping.
5.  Nearby parking scarce so enjoy walking.
6.  Complaint to management regarding (1) and (4) received following response: "we're the cheapest hotel in the Bay Area so we don't care."  
7.  If you care, stay elsewhere.
Not much in the room. Very minimum room amenities. No coffee maker & refrigerator. This place is just good for a quick layover.  However, the staff during my checkin was very good & accomodating.

rude staff, hallways smell of cigarette smoke, loud slamming doors, near freeway and noisy, dusty, and housekeeping threw away my soap that I had brought from home, even though i still had 2 nights to stay!~!!! Do yourself a favor, and dont stay here

review.title: It is what it is!
review.reviewText: In a area where hotels can be pricey, we just needed a hotel to stay in for less than 10 hours. We were traveling and checking in late so spending more money on an expensive hotel for just a clean place to sleep for 9-10 hours wasn't worth the extra expense. Motel 6 fit the criteria!

review.title: Its functional
review.reviewText: It was bigger and nicer on exterior than expected for motel 6... The rest was exactly as expected
looks the hotel is not ready for customer, a lot of facilities are missing, only a bed available, internet is really bad
Pretty much what you'd expect. The additional fee for wi-fi puts it just under the two out of 5 stars level.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest, 
                  Thank you for taking the time to share your review. We strive to provide a comfortable night's rest and are disappointed your stay was unsatisfactory due to the bed comfort issues you describe.   We encourage you to  contact our Guest Relations department at 1-855-787-9864 to record the details of your visit to help us provide a better guest experience in the future.

review.title: Zero amenities.
review.reviewText: No shampoo, etc. Staff told us onsite restaurant opened at 6:30 so we showed up. Didn't open till 7:00. Had to go elsewhere since we were on a schedule. Rough towels, single ply tp. Hard bed and solid foam pillows. Will never return.

review.title: disapointing
review.reviewText: Non-smoking room smelled of stale cigarette smoke, had to open a window & the parking lot was noisy all night.

review.title: Not as pictured
review.reviewText: Pics show updated rooms, bright orange paint is harsh, old broken furniture, beds extremely uncomfortable, lights that u can't turn on-off, had to unscrew light bulbs, manager would not give an upgrade even thought we paid $40 more that the rate they were charging night of check-in. Pics show staying in nice 4 fl bldg, u actually stay in old 3 story bldgs in back. We had to ask for more towels, blankets & pick them up at front desk.

review.title: Not good
review.reviewText: No coffee maker, hair dryer, free wifi, no fridge, no microwave oven, two of the lights cannot be turned on.

review.title: Excellent hotel
review.reviewText: Excellent experience very friendly staff I'll recommend it
cheapest around, clean rooms a half a notch better than most two star hotels

photos.caption: I had to share the room with this guy.

review.title: Location is ok, close to downtown
review.reviewText: Within 5 mins of arriving I found a couple of cockroaches in my room, bed was very uncomfortable and felt like I had to sleep fully dressed on top of the covers.
review.negativeRemarks: Pest control, more comfortable beds.
review.locationRemarks: Good food nearby and easy access to downtown is about all.

review.title: OK ROOM
review.reviewText: Booked the room online but was charged the second time at the counter. Had to argue for refund which took about 20 minutes. I was told that the refund would take up to 15 days which is way longer than average.

review.title: Poor service
review.reviewText: We checked in at about 9:30 pm.  The front desk didn't tell us about the wifi fee so it wasn't until we called the front desk that we discovered the fee. They would not add it to our reservation as we booked through Expedia.  Had to pay cash at front desk and discovered we could not connect to the wifi in our room. Front desk clerk connected us to computer tech after three separate complaints that the call couldn't be completed as dialed.  Solution was to say that Internet wasn't working.  No manager on duty had to wait until morning only to find out that clerk did not dial number properly and didn't log we paid for wifi so had to argue to get a refund.

review.title: Not worth $1
review.reviewText:
Understaffed houskeeping which means your room wont get cleaned
Overworked front desk guy and bullying office manager Anais
They are highly dysfunctional as a team and dont really care about the overall client experience
The security guard and a guy at the front are cool
review.positiveRemarks: next to a breakfast place... they take 40 min to prepare a meal
review.negativeRemarks: everything all the way from check in to check out
review.locationRemarks: half moon bay

review.title: No way no how ever again.
review.reviewText: Had to stay here due to family emergency. Toilet was broken;  no water pressure ( drought ok; but geeez) staff friendly enough but hardly needed. Place packed in week; weekend dead. Workers in week; Noone else here during day or weekends. Just not a place I'd stay again.

review.title: Terrible hotel with shameless staff.
review.reviewText: Stayed 3 nights and room was never cleaned. Every time receptionist promised that they made  note for housekeepers to clean my room first, but it had never been cleaned. At all. Had to walk back and forth for new room keys, clean towels etc and hearing a bunch of "sorry" all the time. Seems it is just normal for them to save money and say "sorry".
review.locationRemarks: Not the best location.

review.title: Decent hotel
review.reviewText: Clean room bed a bit uncomfortable but good for the price (room with kitchen )

review.title: Bad customer service
review.reviewText: I had a broken window that wouldn't seal or lock and the front desk forgot all about my initial call when I called to follow up on my complaint.
Found a used condom in the elevator!. Not as described.
It was good and everything was clean.  We were close to the interstate, which was very nice.
review.negativeRemarks: I would like to see 2 things added to the room, a microwave and a refrigerator

review.title: We thought it was going to be nice.
review.reviewText: We thought it was going to be nice because of the pictures but that's all it is, pictures . The rooms do look like them but the floor was dirty, the bed felt dirty and the sheets felt like it had a bunch of just little dirt and was rough . Wouldnt stay here again.

review.title: Never Again!!!
review.reviewText: The drain in the sink was clogged and they "couldn't fix it", our room had not cleaned when we returned the next day evening, and they did not even have clean towels to bring us.  The plumbing had not been fixed and they refused to move us to a new room.  There was no manager on site, and I will never recommend this to anyone or stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Customer service

review.title: Nice and affordable, near the airport
review.reviewText: There seems to be a lot of variation with this chain of hotels but this Motel 6 was a good version. The room was extra spacious. I got a room with two queen beds which are usually jammed in a smaller room but even after the beds there was ample space. The only reason the staff didn't get 5 stars was because I couldn't find my room! I know but, this was a multi-building hotel and the map they gave me wasn't much help but once I found the room, I went through two different buildings, everything was great. Nice pool too!
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean and spacious rooms. Nice courtyard and pool.
review.negativeRemarks: An express checkout would be great. My flight was for 6am so I needed to checkout at 3:30am, it would be nice to be able to do that from the room
review.locationRemarks: There is a restaurant next door. Unfortunately they're only open for breakfast and early lunch, they closed at 2:30. Close to the airport

review.title: Poorly managed
review.reviewText:
Arrived around 5:30- staff clueless whether there was a room ready for me and indifferent regardless.
Found the property enormous and sketchy people hanging around outside constantly at the back. Just poorly managed.

review.title: Good price in San Fran
review.reviewText: Room they first gave me had not been cleaned we called to let them know after about a 20 minute wait they came to the room and gave is keys to a new room which was much better someone had urinated in the elevator but I know the hotel has no control on that

review.title: Nice Hotel off the Highway
review.reviewText: We had a pleasant stay at this hotel.  We were on our way to San Fransisco, and needed to stop and rest for the night.  Everyone there was pleasant and patient with us.  The room was tidy and spacious.  The only issue I had, was my computer would not connect to the network there.  I don't know if that is their issue, or the networks, but I called for the code and everything, but my computer or devices would not connect to it.  Other than that, it was a great hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Their WIFI connection.
review.locationRemarks: It is in a town and had everything we needed not even 5 minutes away from the hotel.  San Francisco is only 30 minutes away.

review.title: happy stay
review.reviewText: it was clean and staff were very friendly just didn't like how the stares and the elevators were hidden pleanty of parking and clean rooms over all i would stay there again if we were out that way again
review.positiveRemarks: clean friendly staff  easy to get to
review.negativeRemarks: need more signs of were item should be at like stares and elevators
review.locationRemarks: gas station and food is about 6 min away for fast food

managementResponses.response: Thank you for taking the time to post your review.Please accept our apologies for the inconveniences you describe with the odor smell in your guest room. Please call 1-855-787-9864

review.title: Smell
review.reviewText: Room smelled like curry  And we had to sleep with the window open. There wasn't an iron in the room either.

review.title: A letdown for the Motel 6 brand
review.reviewText: towels were pretty course [?] and there was no shampoo. Also there was only coffee in the lobby in the morning.
review.negativeRemarks: Be a little more generous in the freebees.
review.locationRemarks: No problem there.

review.title: The most terrible room I have ever stayed.
review.reviewText: Stuck us in the oldest part of the hotel. Dog barking, dog friendly hotel which we did not know. Can hear the people  going to the bathroom in the next room and hearing flushing from the toilet. The San Carlos airport( which we didn't know about)so we heard airplane going over.  My husband was due at the hospital early the next day and never got any sleep including myself. I would like a refund but probably never get it.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything!!!

review.title: Worst experience
review.reviewText: Asked front staff that I did not need house keeping, and on both days bed was made and personal clothes were moved and touched.  Never going back to that place.

review.title: Terrible Stay
review.reviewText: I don't expect much of you, Motel 6. We both know you aren't The Four Seasons. I dont expect a concierge or a plush suite overlooking the fine city of Belmont. Its safe to say that my expectations for you are reasonable. Clean sheets and a room for the night so we can continue on our journey the next morning. Lo and behold, upon arriving at our room in the late hours of Friday night did we open the door to find a room that had apparently been the scene of a frat house party. Stained dirty sheets, wet towels, and a trashed room greeted us after a long drive. We called the front desk who said they would send a security guard to find us another room, no apologies were offered. After thirty minutes the security guard finally arrived. Laughing off the incident, he found us another room (which he wisely verified was clean) and then left with no apology. The next room was adequate, though hardly acceptable. We accepted our fate, slept a few hours and left in the morning as soon as we could.
review.positiveRemarks: The sight of the Motel 6 in our rear-view mirror.
review.negativeRemarks: I suppose if your intention is to have a late-night tryst with a trucker this hotel is acceptable.
review.locationRemarks: There are plenty of things to do nearby. These things include not staying at this motel and instead opting for a freeway overpass.

review.title: No amenities
review.reviewText: Hotel had one bar of soap only.  No shampoo, no hair dryer, no ironing board, one extra chair.  Internet cost extra.  Was very disappointed in amenities offered.  Had not stayed at Motel 6 previously so maybe this is how they all are.  I don't think we got a good deal on the hotel and could have found a better hotel for similar price. Location was close to freeway but only one restaurant was close by.  Required car to go to store, get gas or fast food.

review.title: Nice and roomy
review.reviewText: Nice and very spacious room for a Motel 6. I liked the laminate flooring.

review.title: Droma
review.reviewText: That place is kind of ghetto the hallways stunk. I got a wake up call at midnight even though I didn't order one.
Staff was friendly and helpful but room was pretty gross

review.title: Looks nice outside, but not really inside.
review.reviewText: Too noisy, all night long you could hear doors slamming. Bathroom door and walls dirty, tub is clean though. Dresser and night stand dusty. They need to hire more people to do housekeeping; just because the motel is old, doesn't mean it has to be dirty too.

review.title: Convenient to Peninsula locations and SFO
review.reviewText: Just right for us. Great value, best of all available options. All went very smoothly through Reception. It was well staffed throughout our stay and responsive to our needs. The room was large, with basic furnishings, but really comfortable and everything working exceptionally well. We had two queen sized beds that were very comfortable. The bathroom had new fixtures as well, with European style efficiency. There were no frills but everything just right. The location is good: convenient and easy to find, easy for getting on and off the highway. The property is very secure. It was just right for us.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, good value, convenient location, comfortable sleeping.
review.locationRemarks: It's about halfway between the SFO airport and Stanford university, which we were visiting. Also convenient to the sea: Half Moon Bay.

review.title: Okay for the price, I guess.
review.reviewText: Do not provide: shampoo/hair dryer/alarm clock/iron.  Dresser drawers had hair in them/not usable.  Beds were very comfy.  Don't pay for WiFi/doesn't work.
No fridge and microwave people who travel with children not stay in motel 6

review.title: Don't do it!
review.reviewText:
We had to ask housekeeping to clean our rooms each day. On the first day, she told us that she might get it tomorrow. 

The mattresses are very thin. 

The water does not get hot, just relatively warm. 

The office staff is pleasant, but everything else is a miss.

review.title: A mess in Belmont
review.reviewText: Hotel was noisy. Halls and common areas were littered with trash. Room was uncomfortable and housekeeping was never done. Asked for towels at front desk and for a reason for lack of housekeeping, the answer was an Ohwell and a shrug of the shoulders. Will never return.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything

review.title: Rental Car in SFO - This works!
review.reviewText:
The property is located right off Route 101, perfect for jumpin on the Highway and driving 30 minutes to get downtown San Francisco (really, just 30 min to Union Square!). 

The rooms are spacious and have A/C.
review.negativeRemarks: Wireless Internet should be free
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants, Highway, Grocery stores ... all near by!

review.title: Close by shopping mall
review.reviewText: Stayed here for 4 nights, was close to all the HWY heading into San Fran, Oakland and such. Good location, clean room with laminate floor. Hot tub and pool was good. close by shopping mall and cheesecake factory. Walls and door may get a bit loud at night, but would book again.

review.title: Tv  Lost signal never came back on . Very noisy .
review.reviewText: All-time worst stay at Motel 6 in my life been trying to reach supervisor to complain cannot get through even with that . make sure I want to marry way to know that this is not the place to go .

review.title: Nice clean and neat hotel
review.reviewText:
Very nice clean hotel..not to far from down town if using a car.
Unfortunatelly the room was not made up by room boy and we surprised when arrived on the second night we found the room was still mesh up.

not clean at room
hairs on towel
bed sheet was not changed

review.title: Convenient but noisy.
review.reviewText: Road noise, next door noise, next floor noise, just too much noise to sleep well

review.title: Bad
review.reviewText: No good, expensive and bad. The room are noisy ,,,,,,,,, mmnnnnmnn

photos.caption: Shower towels are torn and worn out.
Bottle opener signs of long term stays?

review.title: Not what you expect to be next to Oracle.
review.reviewText: Hardwood floors create loud noises coming from rooms upstairs. Lots of smokers hang out outside. Kind of seedy at night. Decent for a night's stay for the price but definitely nothing to brag about. This place needs some serious upgrades.

review.title: Wifi is extra charge, and doesn't work
review.reviewText:
WIFI is an extra charge, PER device, PER day.  I paid for 2 devices x 2 days.
However, WIFI does not work; either the signal is too weak or the Router / Service is broken.

I complained about this to Front Desk, but they still have not reimbursed me for the Wifi charge.
review.negativeRemarks: WIFI
review.locationRemarks: take Highway 101 to Stanford University or San Francisco

review.title: Nice n quiet
review.reviewText: Good experince we slept very well in comfortable beds
review.negativeRemarks: Vending mashines
review.locationRemarks: Restaurant and it's closed to San Francisco

review.title: Disappointing
review.reviewText:
Experienced issues from sign in.
Did not have room with kitchenette that we requested.  Did not apologize - blamed Expedia.
Said they would get back to me in 10 minutes - 1.5 hours later I had to go to front desk to be told they would let me know by cell phone first thing in the morning.  1:30 PM the next day I had to go to front desk to here hem, not apologize for their inconsideration, but to be told We do not have a Studio with kitchenette (which I did not ask for in the first place) but it was Expedia's fault.
Out of 5 night stay, rooms were not cleaned until 6:00 PM on two of the days.
Disappointing, even for a Motel-6
review.positiveRemarks: Many rooms, close to freeway access
review.negativeRemarks: Perhaps staff training
review.locationRemarks: San Francisco and BART

review.title: I recommend.
review.reviewText:
I was in building  4 at ground.  Room was well clean. No bad smell.  It was close to Oracle only 15m walk.
staff was courtious.
The only thing of concern was internet. It was very slow and there was no offering of high speed.

review.title: Highly Disappointing.
review.reviewText:
We got to the area around two, and I decided to call to see if they had any rooms ready so we might check in early. I was told there were rooms available, so we drove over.

Upon check in, we were given a room that wasn't yet ready, (it seemed clean, but the bed was covered in dirty linens.) I alerted the front desk, and we took our bags and went elsewhere for a few hours. As we departed, we could hear an occupant in the room across the hall shrieking loudly.

When we returned later, the entire hallway smelled like marijuana. The room was clean, but hot. The AC unit under the window didn't seem operational. After consulting with the staff at the front desk, the heat and air is controlled by a small, totally not obvious wall panel. (Hang a sign maybe?)

Overall, I am rather disappointed, considering the price I paid for this hotel room.
review.positiveRemarks: The decor was nice, and the room was nicely updated. The kitchenette was also well done.
review.negativeRemarks: Better staff communication.
review.locationRemarks: We went to the Hiller Aviation Museum, and ate breakfast at Hobbee's.

review.title: Bargain hotel on SF Peninsula
review.reviewText: Motel 6 offers basic, no-frills accommodations at below market prices.  That has always been their recipe and it works for the budget traveler.  I travel with my dog who is always welcome at Motel 6 at no additional charge. The bed was comfortable, the TV worked, and the shower water was hot.  Convenient location to all points in the San Francisco Bay Area.

review.title: Needed a two beds in San francisco
review.reviewText: Next to freeway so that's convenient. McDonalds and fuel station a mile down the street. Pretty crappy looking inside. Some black marks on the walls and the carpet wasn't clean to my standards. I feel like $120 is too expensive for a room with two beds and a bathroom. But I guess that's San Francisco for you!

review.title: Nice remodeled hotel
review.reviewText: I always enjoy my stay at Motel 6. I like how they remodeled the motel 6 in all areas to make it look more comfortable and relaxing for people like me that are always utilizing hotels. It was kind of noisy with a big truck in the parking lot and people slamming doors but me and my fianc really enjoyed it.

review.title: would not return
review.reviewText: Be prepared to pay for wifi and not have any signal in some rooms.  The sheets and pillow cases had holes in them in the first room, the second room they gave us smelled TERRIBLE!!!! And I had to go back to the front desk three times before I recieved a key card that actually opened the door to the room! If you are a light sleeper this is not the place for you, as walls seem pretty thin and the noise levels were pretty high.  The drunks spilling beer in the elevator and the very strong smell of marijuanna in the hallways didn't help with the overall ambience either!!

review.title: Hotel near the airport
review.reviewText:
OK, although would have appreciated a coffe maker. 
They charge for the wifi which is odd at this day and age
review.negativeRemarks: Coffee maker

review.title: It was nice
review.reviewText:
No soap or shampoo in the bathroom.

Also, you have to go to the front desk for an ironing board as well as an iron.

review.title: closed to main freeway  in route to san francisco
review.reviewText: closed to main freeway  in route to san francisco 20 minutes away from san francisco.

review.title: Never book this hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly, even tho it was very hard to understand them. Unfortunately the room was absolutely appalling! Roaches, bullet holes, stains on the bed and very thin walls were only the tip of the iceberg. The hallway smelled like mildew, which also permeated the room. The elevator was etched with gang signs.
review.negativeRemarks: This place needs a major overhaul from start to finish
review.locationRemarks: One hour way from San Francisco.

review.title: Functional. Thin walls. Bleach smell
review.reviewText: When we arrived, the room smelled of bleach, which dissipated over the two days. I guess that that means it was cleaned, but i haven't noticed that in any other hotels The floors and walls are thin and neighboring young kids keep me awake. There were only two accessible power sockets, glad i brought a power strip with me

the staff isnt overly friendly.

it's a smoke free property but our entired floor smelled like marijuana being smoked.  the room door slam every room minutes. why isnt there a soft close feature.  got very little rest.  would never stay there again or refer it to anyone else to stay there.

review.title: Excellent customer service
review.reviewText: After a very long day at the airport with flight delays I was pleased with a fast check in and excellent customer service

review.title: Cheap and by the airport
review.reviewText: Good hotel to stay one night. Newly renovated. Clean. Bed was comfortable. No extras. $3 a night wifi for one device. No shampoo and conditioner in bathroom just a bar of soap.

review.title: Best burger in town restaurant was great
review.reviewText:
So I was hungry and went west on rhialton blvd just to find restaurant that had excellent food.

Then made a right on Camino real blvd and found Mollie Stones markets which is also super delicious. 

After eating went to the pool had some drinks just to end up on the jacuzzi and relax.

Best time with the family.

review.title: Bare bones essentials...
review.reviewText: The room is very plain much like a dorm room. Very bare bones. Soap but no shampoo.... It was clean. The water pressure was pretty weak too. If you just need a place to sleep this will work. The little restaurant had a pretty good breakfast at a reasonable price.
review.positiveRemarks: It is just ok. If you are looking for more than the basics stay somewhere else. The rate was fair and in my case it was the only place available.
review.negativeRemarks: They could provide shampoo and conditioner. The curtains could also be improved to actually block out the light.
review.locationRemarks: I was there for a meeting at Oracle Corp which was a 2 block walk. Uber is extremely convenient in the area with never more that a 3 min wait.

review.title: Terrible place to stay
review.reviewText:
- Though the building looks nice from outside - its a typical Motel 6.
- Front desk staff does not care much about the guests. Sometimes quite rude as well.
- Housekeeping was done only once in 3 days
- They charge $2.99/day for Internet access and the speed is pathetic. Speed goes down considerably in the evening, through the night and is not good enough, even for regular emails and work stuff.

Absolutely not recommended; unless the next option for you to stay is on streets.

review.title: Espaciius  Hotel  room but staff  service   so so
review.reviewText: We  try  to  get   Internet  conection  , but  I  didn't   have  it . External  ooutsourcing  for  internet  arent  good  attendant . During  3  days  I cannot  obtain  connection  and  any  solution  for  staff . During  check out I  ask  for  refund but  Staff  tell to  me  to wait 21 minutes  because  hour  4 and a half  morning  they can't do it . I was rush to airport .

review.title: Smell
review.reviewText: The hotel was not the same as on the webpage . Elevator smell horrible and the room too!!!

We were given a room 2 rooms away from the elevator. There was something wrong with the elevator causing it to make a very loud noise constantly.  It was difficult to sleep with the constant noise. We mentioned this to the desk clerk when we were leaving and received no response or acknowledgement. Terrible motel.
Toilet not cleaned. Doors slamming all night. Poor TV reception. Not enough pillows or blankets.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything

review.title: horrible
review.reviewText: bed was rock hard.  no coffee pot.  no pen in the room to fill out the survey of our stay!
review.positiveRemarks: my husband chose this hotel.  close to the airport and the price was right.
review.negativeRemarks: everything!
review.locationRemarks: nothing.

review.title: House of the slamming doors
review.reviewText:
The Hotel is clean, but they have an issue with loud closning doors. Starting 4AM you will wake up several times on loud doors slamming, I was never in a hotel before where this was a problem. It would be such an easy fix, but that's not what this hotel is about. TV remote didn't work, deadbolt defective, smoke odor in hallway, nobody could get in at the door next to the elevator (card entry did not work). 

No Wifi and no fridge but I understand this is not advertised.
review.negativeRemarks: Overall maintenance of little things that would be easy to fix.

review.title: Great Place and excellent customer service!
review.reviewText: Reasonable pricing, modern setting and easy access to CalTrain!
review.negativeRemarks: A microwave!
review.locationRemarks: Based upon individual preference

review.title: old and sad
review.reviewText:
they didn't have my reservation
smells like old wet dog every where
my toilet bursted and water overflow half the room. gross

review.title: Back home.  I lived in Belmont 30 years ago.
review.reviewText: I was pleased to find a reasonably priced motel in Belmont.  Motel 6 was conveniently located to the freeway and to Ralston Ave. as I had a lot of local spots to see.  Ralston Ave. connects with Hwy #92 with a direct route to Half Moon Bay and to SFO on Hwy #280.  The motel was clean, quiet and well managed.  The beds were comfortable and the room was easily adjusted for heat or cool.  The only problem was the elevator closest to our room was out or order, and it was inconvenient being on the 3rd floor.  The other elevator involved a lot of walking and dragging  of luggage through narrow doors and hallways.  Other than that, I would stay there again and request a different location of the room.
review.positiveRemarks: the location, the price and the clean rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Having the2nd  elevator working.
review.locationRemarks: Ralston Ave. access to Hwy #92 to the Coast, and Hwy #280 to SFO. #92 to East Bay across the San Mateo Bridge. Beautiful city Belmont.

review.reviewText: Smells ,doors slams shut, no carpet,hair in the towels

review.title: Price was its best feature
review.reviewText:
The property was well maintained and clean. Overall a nice place. I was disappointed with the
furnature and lack of outlets in the room.

review.title: One night stay
review.reviewText: Overall grounds were nicely kept. Ice machine has to b fixed. Rooms were roomy and clean. Bed was comfortable. Since my daughter will b going to school at Treasure Island I will b visiting area at least once a month I will stay here again.  Do recommend price was good.

review.title: No hot water for 2 days
review.reviewText:
On Sunday 2/8/15 I woke up and tried to take a shower I found no hot water. I called the office and was told maintenance would take care of it. I did not return until 1am and still no hot water.
I went to office and was told they did not have maintenance on Sunday. I will not stay at this motel again.

review.title: Can be a lot better
review.reviewText:
We were looking for rooms for a 2 night stay, close to Oracle. Extended stay was fully booked and I came across Motel 6 as an option. 

1) Reception Staff-: No smiles, take in details, sign form and off you go. Hardly feels like a welcome

2) Facilities -: Room was clean. AC, TV and plugs were working, No coffee maker in regular room. No iron box. Had to go back to reception and ask for it. Then take it all the way back. Wondering why they cant provide one in all the rooms. The lights near the bed weren't working. Rooms are cleaned daily, which is a plus. No quick grab and go breakfast facility either

3) Ambience -: The hallway smelt of smoke. Maybe some guests were smoking in spite of the non-smoking boards. Shows that the fire alarm might not be working, which indeed is a cause of concern. 


Overall, not a bad place to stay in for a couple of nights. But I would prefer extended stay anyday.
review.negativeRemarks: Lots of things... read review
review.locationRemarks: Its close to offices. The eateries are some way out.

review.reviewText: The experience was good enjoyed myself and very relaxing.

review.title: Terrible Hotel: Beware
review.reviewText: The hotel is clearly not up to Motel 6 standards. The rooms are threadbare (mine had the flooring damaged by water). You have groups of hotel residents coming and going at all hours with groups congregating outside the hotel through the night. This is not a hotel fit for family or the professional.
review.locationRemarks: Near I10

review.title: couldnt sleep
review.reviewText: Doors slamming in the stairwell by my room sounded like someone was breaking in. The beds were not to bad and the shower was hot forgot shampoo. For the price you can't complain if you need a place to stay it's a steal

review.title: Good value for the money
review.reviewText: You'll have to pay for Internet. Close to the airport if you need to take a flight.
The outside door was so loud I couldn't sleep, I heard everyone who came through the door. The room didn't have carpet which made the room very cold, since it was raining.
Great location for where I was going, and quiet rooms on the buildings facing the bay. Worked out great.

review.title: Safe, Clean, and Great Value
review.reviewText:
Good location, clean and safe... which made for a great value!

Need to ask for blow dryer or iron to be brought to room.

Good diner type restaurant on site.
review.negativeRemarks: Answer the front desk phone. I called multiple times and sat on the phone with it ringing for more than 5 minutes each.
review.locationRemarks: Great for all business travelers with companies in that area. Lots of restaurant, bars, etc. within a short Uber ride.

review.title: Mixed reaction to room condition when walking in
review.reviewText:
Bathroom looked great when walking in as did wooden floors. Bedspread looked stained. Bed mattress looked weak and cheap. No bed bug signs, so glad. Furniture looked beat up, chair broken. Needed sign to remind you that the wall control was how to control heating/cooling. I would have given 3 stars, but bed and furniture looked sub-standard even for this hotel chain. Only bathroom issue was wobbly toilet tank structure.

I didn't care for the rude neighbors who let their front doors slam when entering and leaving. I wore ear plugs so I could sleep through that.
review.positiveRemarks: Bathroom and great shower, very good water flow, and super clean looking. Loved the wooden floors too, as I have dust allergies.
review.negativeRemarks: Replace the furniture, mattress, and bedspread. Make front doors close quietly when closing, now they slam.!
review.locationRemarks: This location was very accessible to freeway.

review.title: Next to Oracel
review.reviewText: A pleasant walk through Oracle grounds, including a nice close-up view of the America's Cup winner on the pond.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient to San Mateo.  Wood floors nice in case of puppy accident.  no extra charge for pets.  Pet walking area right outside our room.

review.title: Laughably awful
review.reviewText: This is what you would get if you were making a movie and wanted to set it in a stereotypically awful motel.  The check in staff were on the rude side of civil, the hallway smelled smoky and disgusting, and the room was pretty close to a prison cell.  All I can say in favor of this place is that it was somewhere to sleep at a reasonable price in an area where the other motels were super pricey.
review.negativeRemarks: More pleasant staff, cleaner hallways, even slightly more appealing rooms.

review.title: Never again
review.reviewText:
The room was located in the back part of the hotel, the old version. The elevator smelled like feces and urine like a homeless person resides there. 
In my room I could hear everything going on in other rooms. 
For the price that you pay for the room, I was expecting at least an iron..nope! Nothing of that sort, felt like a boarding house just a bed, TV, and a desk. 
The staff was nice, but that was it. Save your $$, or spend a little more and stay somewhere nice. I only stayed for 12hrs (overnight) so I put up with it, but it was like camping.

review.title: It is more for construction crews than families.
review.reviewText: Only one night stand, plastic chair, no clock, no blow dryer, no coffee maker, no shampoo,conditioner  etc, no ice in machine, no stay there!  Not worth the price.

review.title: A cheap hotel by SF Bay Area prices.
review.reviewText: The women in the evening at Check In was very nice and helpful. The rooms are newer in look. We have stayed at ACCOR Hotels in Europe and Asia. Not as nice as those at IBIS Hotels, but pretty comfortable. Also, a short distance from SFO and reasonable distance from San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Just off highway, close to the City.
review.negativeRemarks: If you want a basic room, this has what you're looking for.
review.locationRemarks: About 10 miles from SFO. Close to San Mateo Bridge. Off Hwy. 101.

review.title: Barebone Lodging
review.reviewText:
We only stayed for one night. Our flight left SFO very early in the morning so we left before dawn.

Pros: Close to SFO, close to US 101, friendly staff, clean rooms without any frills
Cons: Noisy

OK for the money if do not expect much more than a door to lock behind you and a bed to sleep in.
review.negativeRemarks: Sound insulation, double glazing

review.title: No services
review.reviewText: No fridge, far away from town, no coffee maker in room, only 3 pillows, no counter for toiletries.

review.title: Very relaxing
review.reviewText: Comfortable and relaxing for us and our dog Jersey

review.title: Economical housing near Oracle offices
review.reviewText: Utilitarian, no frills, & bare bones but clean. Very nice pool area but pool did need pool company to visit more often. Remodel only allowed for 1 nightstand & electrical outlet under the desk. We had brought extra extension cords to stretch to nightstand for medical equipment. Recharged computer in bathroom.
review.positiveRemarks: It was very convenient to our activities.
review.negativeRemarks: No Don't Disturb sign available. Few Towels. Cleaning Staff limited English.
review.locationRemarks: Well located for access to San Francisco & Bay area.

review.title: Ok
review.reviewText:
Hotels  in San Francisco very expensive.  Hotel two
Star cost same  a four star in regular place
The bathroom floor was dirty. The bed and pillows were uncomfortable.  Too noisy, doors slamming all night, could not sleep.
review.negativeRemarks: everything
review.locationRemarks: did not attempt

review.title: Hotel Stay
review.reviewText: Average room with a small bath & sink. Would have like it a little bigger.

review.title: Simple but pretty close to airport
review.reviewText: Very minimle room but if your there just to sleep it is fine. No hair dryer, or iron, or tissues, one wash cloth, no carpet. Does gave a pool though.

review.title: Nice hotel with good rates for proximity to SF.
review.reviewText: Excellent handicapped rooms on first floor.  Easy access to lobby and vending.  Nice pool and spa.  Staff was very friendly and accommodating.  Great restaurant next door for breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: Countertops in handicapped room for a place to set toiletries.

review.title: Good place to rest your head.
review.reviewText: For a place just to sleep for the night, it's perfect.  Other than that, don't expect too much.

review.title: Sorry, you didn't pay for that.
review.reviewText:
We were only going to be in San Francisco for a few days and planned on spending most of our time not at the hotel, so we figured a Motel 6 would be perfect; i.e., a nice place to sleep aand nothing more or less.  There were less expensive hotels to be found, by the way.  The hotel is very convenient to downtown San Francisco by public transit or car.

Upon check-in the employee at the front desk advised us that we "made a mistake with the reservation" because our reserved room had one king bed and we didn't want that.  We were, after all, two men checking into a room with only one bed.  Except that my partner and I absolutely only wanted one bed.  And, we were in very close proximity to San Francisco, so I can't imagine that same-sex couples are a rare encounter.  I understand perhaps wanting to clarify that we only wanted one bed, but there's a tactful way to approach that situation, and this was not it.

Then we arrived at the room and it appeared nice enough, until we stepped far enough into the room to see the bed/living area and realized that there was literally a bed and a TV/TV stand...nothing else.  And even worse is that the room was large, so it felt very empty and unwelcoming.  We called the front desk and the same gentleman that checked us in advised us that we "didn't pay for that."  Apparently, there are extra charges for what is considered part of a standard room at every other hotel we've ever stayed at.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient to San Francisco and affordable
review.negativeRemarks: Better description of what you are or aren't getting in the room for the posted rate(s).
review.locationRemarks: Close proximity to San Francisco without being too close; lots of eateries and shopping nearby.

review.title: Terrible hotel!
review.reviewText: The hotel was unkept, graffiti in the elevator, broken floor titles in the elevator. Though it was a non smoking room, there was a hint of smoke smell. No shampoo in the room, nor hair dyer. Towels and bed sheets were to scratchy. Too noisy when people close their room doors, doors would slam hard and loud. Awful for the price! Never again, don't book a room here. Very disappointing!
review.negativeRemarks: Clean it up
review.locationRemarks: 20 min drive to SF was ok

review.title: Ok place just to sleep.
review.reviewText: The room had no carpet which didn't help hide the stained wood floors. The pillows smelled like smoke in the non smoking room. First choice hotel was booked so we gave this a shot, it's over-priced for being a  motel 6. In this case we didn't get what we paid for.....
review.negativeRemarks: The cleanliness of the pillows and sheets.they smelled like smoke.
review.locationRemarks: By the freeway, just stayed there to get a fresh start on our way to. San Fransisco.

review.title: Just needed a place to sleep...
review.reviewText: Came in late at night, got room no problem, decent room, bed, shower, checked out at 4am to catch a flight out of SFO...easy and clean.

review.title: Surprised
review.reviewText: Not like other Motel 6's I have stayed at.  Room was nearly bare.  Absolutely no comforts, not even tissues.  Bed, tv, ans table, that was it.  When I asked about wifi I was told it was 2.99 a day.  Doors banging all night, loud talking, banging overhead.  It was nearly 5:00am before it quieted down enough to sleep.  Due to this it was close to 11 before I got to lobby in the morning and coffee was gone.  There was no coffee in the room.  I spoke with the manager, a very pleasant young woman and told her of our experience.  She immediately said she would contact Expedia and pit through a 40.00 credit on the room charge.  I told her that wasn't necessary, I was just giving her FYI feedback.  She insisted and put through the credit.  Very nice of her.  I hope she shares the feedback with the owner and changes are made.

review.title: Nice stay, good motel 6
review.reviewText: I have stayed here previously so I was comfortable here. Clean hotel, clean room, good price. I have stayed in many motel 6 hotels and this one is one good one.

review.title: Have to changed room do to a smell in room & hall
review.reviewText: Changed room to a weat smell in room and hallway also went given a second room the two days I stay their was not room cleaning

review.title: functional and clean
review.reviewText: It was functional and clean, I was not vacationing so it served it's purpose, I was disappointed to find after I got there the pool had been drained for maintenance. WiFi is $3.00 a day and the connection speed is as slow as a snail. I think dial up was faster.
review.positiveRemarks: It was functional and clean It was the best cheap motel i could find. some others cost more with worse facilities and in bad to unsafe locations.
review.negativeRemarks: WiFi is $3.00 a day and the connection speed is as slow as a snail. I think dial up was faster.
review.locationRemarks: the location was convenient to the freeway

review.title: Hotel near airport. Could hear the planes.
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean. However there were a lot of people that seemed to be living in the hotel. It was kind of scary, several men hanging around outside of rooms did not feel safe with just me and my daughter staying alone so we skipped on pool and hot tub and stayed locked in our room, I don't get creeped out easy either.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was friendly. Fast check in and check out.
review.locationRemarks: Was a quick 10 minute drive to SFO and cheaper than staying close to airport. But you get what you pay for.

review.title: Modern Rooms
review.reviewText: Overall the experience was very nice would stay again, beds were comfortable, bathroom was clean. The only negative was there was not many outlets at all and with four of us staying in the room it became very problematic
review.positiveRemarks: the room had wood floors which was very nice, had a very updated and modern feel.
review.negativeRemarks: more outlets in the rooms, additional pillows would have been nice also
review.locationRemarks: there was a shopping center with places to eat, a Safeway, etc. which was convenient,very close to the freeway made it easy to get to San Francisco

review.title: nice bed
review.reviewText: i was asking for towels for like 2 hours but nothing came to me. i was asking for an extra blanket but nobody showed to my room until i went to the front desk and get it by myself.

review.title: Ok for money
review.reviewText: You get what you pay for.  Short stay so didn't mind too much. Not too far from train. Decent pool. Bring your own everything. Nothing in room but basics.

review.title: Good inexpensive hotel
review.reviewText: No frills. Clean. Had to borrow a blow dryer from the front desk. They don't have shampoo or lotion in the room. Free coffee in the morning. Pool looked inviting.

review.title: Disgusting in California
review.reviewText: Our comforters had cigarette burn holes in them, the swimming pool was Very Dirty didn't even swim in it. The hot tub was the same way!!  The front of the motel towards highway was very deceiving it appeared nice. & new then there is the back area where are room was  located which was dirty, we couldn't find elevator so we carried all of our luggage up the stairs. a lot people  were hanging around the parking lots drinking and being loud apparently they live there from what I heard, Tried calling desk several times but no one answered!! This motel should be rated accordingly 1 1/2 stars at the most :(:(

review.title: Extremely noise all the night...
review.reviewText: Mostly all the guest come from construction companies.

review.title: Ok hotel
review.reviewText: Room was not terrible but first appearances were disappointing

review.title: You get what you pay for. (Maybe)
review.negativeRemarks: Upkeep leaves something to be desired. They could really stand to inspect each room closer. For instance my door didn't work properly. Small details.`
review.locationRemarks: Area around it. Good sources of transportation nearby, nice parks and scenery to the north. Don't be afraid to cross the highway on foot/bike.

review.title: For Motel 6, very new & large rm (studio w/ kitch
review.reviewText: Was told didn't have r res thru Expedia, pretty adament even thou I had my conf. THEN, found it. The 2 clerks that were helping me were in conflict w/ ea other w/ "I told you so energy". Because we had a studio (whole bldg had kitchens), the blding & hallways very stinky & lots of NOISE as it was filled w/ families & dogs.  Our toilet & fridge gurgled all 3 nights.  Last night we arrived to a totally UNMADE up room, so no clean towels & I had to go all the way BACK to office (LARGE complex & our bldg was at the end). They would NOT bring them to us as "housekeeping was closed".  Was there for a trade show in Downtown San Fran & very tired, so having to put my clothes back on & walk back to get our towels did not make me happy, esp having to walk down the LONG stinky, noisy hallway again that night (& stinky elevator).  Esp paying what we did   fees & tax.  Didn't need studio but is all they had avail. Convenient to the frwy.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient to freeway & bldgs secured by room keys.

review.title: Good value hotel
review.reviewText: Good experience, clean,  quiet......................

review.title: Motel 6, Belmont, CA
review.reviewText: The room was absolutely horrible. Bathroom had facial hair all over the sink, and used soap was given to us. Also, I was told we had a fridge and microwave, and we did not. Hotel staff was just as bad as our horrendous room.

review.title: Perfect for visitors
review.reviewText: I stayed for 3 nights although I was barely in the room other than to shower and sleep. I was on the main floor thanks to the receptionist who noticed how heavy my luggage was. The price was right. Clean, simple room, nice and quiet, the staff was there to help for any reason, and loved the free coffee in the morning. My only complaint would be the lack of WiFi.

review.title: Convenient
review.reviewText: The doors slap shut. The noise factor is awful. Have a bunch of unwanted people ganging out trying to get in hotel in middle of night.
review.positiveRemarks: Only price but it was not worth it. You get for what you pay.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything

review.title: Bare bones hotel close to business meetings
review.reviewText:
If you're meeting in Foster City or San Mateo and need a bare bones hotel with a bed, shower, and not much else: this is a great place to save some money.

Easy to access off the freeway system, with a larger and relatively inexpensive (yet perfectly passable) restaurant attached to the lobby - open at 7am - and surprisingly quiet in Building C.  My room window had an excellent view of Oracle headquarters; a good reminder that this hotel is very near the technology heart of Silicon Valley.

The WiFi is pay-per-use and can't be purchased from the room - be sure to get a prepaid access card at the front desk, and don't count on them reminding you.  I forewent this inconvenience since I travel with a 4G hotspot anyway, but there was something which makes me angry about being asked to pay for WiFi in the 21st century anyway.  If McDonald's can dish it out for free, so can a major hotel.  Bad form.

The bed was large and quite firm, the shower was typically anemic due to California water conservation standards, and overall my experience was restful enough to be satisfied after a long first day of meetings and to awake refreshed enough to commence day 2.

For families or those on a budget passing through, I would recommend this as a no-frills hotel with rates less than half of its nearest neighbors and easy freeway access to go North or South.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff, convenient restaurant open at 7am
review.negativeRemarks: Paying for WiFi in 2014 is like a donkey with a spinning wheel.  Something about it will just never feel right.
review.locationRemarks: You're within 10 miles of most of the technology headquarters in Foster City - Hitachi, Sony, Oracle, you name it.

review.title: room next to the elevotor, heard all night.
review.reviewText: room was next to the elevtor, heard it all night long, only one wash cloth per room, light in room all night from outside, curtains to small for room. ask for a room next to brothers room, he was on second floor we were on third floor, we will not be back.
review.negativeRemarks: everything.

review.title: Highly doubt you will post this searing review.
review.reviewText: Disastrous experience.  As I already mentioned on your Expedia website, I booked 3 rooms but when we checked in they could find the 2 rooms and didn't have another room available - so 5 adults and 4 children had to cram into 2 rooms.  Manager says we booked smoking, I said "no" (reservation confirmation does show non-smoking).  He went to check to see if any rooms were ready (it was about 3:15), came back and said they were ready.  When we went to the rooms, they were in the SMOKING wing.  Went back to desk, he says nothing else available - then finally said we could upgrade into studios - for additional $'s;  after some bickering he did finally give us a discount.  Did not realize I had book double beds (thought all motels now had queens).  Since we lost one room, luckily two of my great grandkids are tiny for their age since they had to share such a small bed with their siblings.  Also, there was a woman at the front desk who has apparently been trying to get some sort of restitution for items that were stolen from her room during her stay several weeks earlier; manager said maybe one of the maids responsible - not his responsibility!  Having heard that, we did NOT leave any valuables in the rooms!
review.positiveRemarks: Obviously, not much - other than that it is relatively new and looks clean.
review.negativeRemarks: "Management" is obviously nonexistent.
review.locationRemarks: No comment

review.reviewText: Good stay, big clean room. But no shampoo...wifi isn't free, bad cell phone reception with t mobile.

review.title: Not Bad
review.reviewText:
The hotel was not bad at all. You can pretty much figure on what you will get when you stay at a motel 6
This one was just like all the rest ok
review.negativeRemarks: nothing really
review.locationRemarks:
right off of 101 near 

Near El Camino

review.title: Things that go boom in the night
review.reviewText:
Checking fast and as agreed
Room sparten but clean
Room doors close with a boom. They open and close boom boom boom all night
You pay for cell phone access to your email. You can't get out any other way. Or drive away from their damping field.

review.title: Never again...
review.reviewText: This was a noisy and awkward stay.  The room was non-smoking, but smelled like cigarette smoke, the halls and lobby were not vacuumed and dog pee on the exterior corners of the buildings.  I'm all for saving money, but even on a budget, things can be clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness

review.title: Noisy
review.reviewText: In and out from the room is like slamming a door,you will get frighten in the midnight time.
review.negativeRemarks: I think if the room have provide a fridge and water boiler is much better then keep walking to the front desk asking for hot water.

review.title: Stay
review.reviewText:
We got there and had reserved a non smoking room and they said they were all sold out and so we had no other option but to stay in a smoking room.  so we took that and it was awful. smelled like smoke bad.
was not happy about it at all.

Motel staff was very kind and room was clean
It was nice!

review.title: The worst  hotel I ever stayed. Never again .
review.reviewText: I paid almost a hundred to this motel. When I reached I was so disappointed to see it . It's just like a cheap motel with no facilities at all. No coffee machine,no iron board , no microwave . No refrigerator . They charge for wifi/internet which does not works at all.

review.title: Nice Cheap hotel close to freeway.
review.reviewText:
This hotel turned out to be better than what we ere expecting.
As a matter of fact, it was a nice hotel for what we paid in 4th. of July week-end in San Francisco.
I liked wood flooring and bright colors in our room.
I believe it is a great place if you need a room for a short stay and you want to save your money for ........
There was no shampoo and we did not care.
review.negativeRemarks:
The coffee at the lobby was poor.
I do not mind if they remove it.

review.title: Horrible service!
review.reviewText: We were supposed to have non smoking rooms and when we got there, we were told to go into a room that smelled like there was a cigarette party there. In addition we asked for extra blankets and we were told we could not get any extra blankets, the room did not seem clean it seemed like they went and picked up and put new towels that was it. They did switch us room but the staff was really upset, then it said on our reservation that we would have free WiFi, but when we got there we were told we had to pay 2.99, after we payed the WiFi never worked. Overall, I am never going back to this place. Also, the pool was only open from 9-9 that sucked!
review.negativeRemarks: the room should be more clean, the pool should be more clean and opened more hours. Some of the staff should improve their attitude.
review.locationRemarks: Not sure

review.title: nice place ten minutes from the airport
review.reviewText: spacious room, nice king size bed, hardwood floors, small bathroom, low water pressure in the shower
It's a motel 6, decent price, decent accomodations, Coffee shop adjoining to motel was wonderful.....

review.contentCodes: CRMD REMOD NLI PD HMP MMD
review.title: False advertising
review.reviewText: None of the things the add says are true. There were people smoking drugs in the halls, there is no breakfast provided. No internet included. No mini fridge or microwave. The room had two bed with only sheets no blankets. The bathroom had two towels after the first night the maid took them and no others were provided. Worst hotel experience ever.

review.title: Not worth the money
review.reviewText: This hotel was clean but not worth 100 bucks a night. There was very minimal amenities in the room. There was no shampoo/conditioner. Just a single bar of soap. And you had to pay daily for wifi. I would expect this sort of thing if I was only paying 50 bucks a night but 100?! I should at least have access to basic supplies. The restaurant closed at 230 in the afternoon and the elevator was in major need of repair. Overall not a great experience and definitely not worth the money.

review.title: It did the job.
review.reviewText: Staff were nice enough, although I didn't interact with them much other than check-in. The room was obviously renovated. Everything was new and fresh. My only complaint is that because of the newness, the laminate hardwood-look floors still had a very strong odor to them. Otherwise, I would stay here again and hopefully the smell will have dissipated by then.

review.title: Bad place
review.reviewText: My room was below average it had a bed a TV and a bath room no alarm clock no microwave, it had laundry facilities but two of the 4 dryers were broken I heard bad things going on through the paper thin walls also a lot of young people drinking slamming doors swearing yelling, I seen no security for the motel but the Police were all ways at the office.

review.title: Motel 6 Belmont
review.reviewText:
The first room had water from A/C all over the floor. 2nd Room OK, but neither room had carpet on the floors, so the room was noisy. Pillows were like rocks. Minimal towels, one small and one wash cloth. Room had no amenities; coffee only the lobby.

Adjacent Restaurant, Hobbies is very nice for Breakfast and Lunch no Dinner.
review.negativeRemarks: Carpets

review.title: Broken rooms
review.reviewText: Everything was thrashed all the hotel had new remodeled floors and that was the oy good thing about it everything else was scary dangerous and gross

review.title: Just the basics
review.reviewText: Large hotel appeared to be frequented by construction workers and tradesmen. Quite noisy in the hallways until late at night. Accepts pets but no designated pet area and owners do not pick up after their pets. Adjacent restaurant doesn't open until 7am. Room clean but sheets were on rubber mattress cover. Desk personnel very friendly. Daily charge for WIFI.

review.title: Cheapo (Dump) Basic.
review.reviewText:
I got a room here during a family trip. My mother saw the place and said simply its a dump. I really hated the fake wood floors in the rooms and bathroom. My kid saw the pool and said its terrible. I looked at it and saw leaves and heavily chlorinated green water. My kid also pointed out there were no TV stations for him, he was right. There were broken tiles in the elevator, beds that had dilapidated springs, and no coffee maker in the room. When I went to bed the room was filled with this orange/yellow light from a light outside the window that the draperies couldn't block out. The desk/chair in the room was obviously the cheapest thing available.

I asked for a room not facing the freeway and got a room in the corner of two buildings facing the freeway and stairwell. When walking to the room a large dog was barking very loudly in one of the rooms near us (someone had broken the rule about not leaving the dog alone in the room). I returned to the front desk and I got a different room overlooking the pool.

Morning? When I woke up I said that wasn't really bad. It turned out we were nearly alone on the floor. Thus as a major plus it was quiet.

Overall - I cancelled the second night and just paid 30% more and got a room elsewhere. This place is basic, don't expect anything more.
review.negativeRemarks: Carpet flooring, broken tiles, pool.
review.locationRemarks: Memorial Day Trip to San Francisco/Family

review.title: Bad hotel
review.reviewText: Doesnt provide shampoo.... u need to carry the iron box n board to ur room..too many pets litter every where

review.title: Very basic
review.reviewText: Wasn't value compared to other places we had stayed .. Walls were paper thin.. Noisy neighbours and nothing available .. Had to pay for wifi and staff seemed a little reluctant to help and nothing to do

review.title: Worst Hotel I've ever been to.
review.reviewText: dirty bedding, outside doors to the building were unlocked so anyone could get in. Elevators smelled like a homeless person and were tagged with graffiti. We tried to get a refund and find another place to stay, but the front desk was very unhelpful. They ended up refunding our money, but it took a long drawn out process.

review.title: Not as good as I imagine
review.reviewText:
Arrived bit late in the afternoon.

Standard check in with no smile from the staff

Fair room size.

review.title: Not what I expected
review.reviewText: I have stayed several times at a Motel 6 in Texas, rooms were clean is this ones only similarity. Will never recommend or stay here again...the smell of smoke was horrendous, irritating my allergies for 2 days. The complimentary coffee was horrible, no other offers of even water or juice were available.

review.title: cheap, smelly
review.reviewText: what an ugly place, but cheap, and staff are apologetic, but because I had reserved from expedia they couldn't refund me money on the inconveniences of moving rooms and building cards not working and towels not being available and strong smells in the non-smoking floor of our first room. Never staying here again because I like a modern hotel room with screens on the windows and hate strong smells. But don't let me stop you if cheap is your first priority.

review.title: Easy
review.reviewText:
Was in town for my brother's wedding and we had a lot of activities planned, so it was important to have the hotel be simple and easy. Check in was super simple; no crazy holds or deposits or anything. I confirmed my reservation, was able to pay for my room ahead of time and then check out was as simple as turning in my keys.

They were doing a lot of work on the hotel when I was there; changing the locks etc so there was QUITE a bit of noise. The beds were remarkable comfy though and I honestly slept like a baby. The price being about 90 bucks, however, I would have liked to see much more in the area of amenities; but we had a nice time. At the end of the day I was glad I stayed there.

review.title: Not bad
review.reviewText: Sparse room, decent bed, small bathroom, no soundproofing through the main door to the hallway.

review.title: Good place at SF South Bay
review.reviewText:
This was a really good place in the South Bay.
Very clean rooms and grounds and the front desk staff was courteous and efficient.
I highly recommend for business or pleasure and will stay there again.

The room we stayed in was very nice, clean and comfortable. We stayed here to be near the San Francisco Airport for a morning flight. The staff was very friendly. We stopped at IHOP to eat breakfast on our way to the airport. I think there needs to be a refrigerator and coffee maker in each room.
review.negativeRemarks: Need to have a refrigerator and coffee maker in room. There was not a sufficient amount of washcloths for the amount of guests.
review.locationRemarks: We selected this motel because it was near the San Francisco Airport.

review.title: Presently quite
review.reviewText: Quite vacationing in the area they left the light on nice quite

review.title: OK kind of Hotel. just servers you stay purpose...
review.reviewText: You need to pay for every small thing.. Rent doesn't inclue the Wi-fi.. no breakfast.you have to visit the front office for always..just a small soap you get, no other bath stuff. it seems there are always lot of workers around.. asked to lock the room all the time when you are in.
review.negativeRemarks: Facilities on Internet and Bath needs.
review.locationRemarks: close to major IT companies. easy access.

review.title: Needed lodging near work...
review.reviewText: The staff was helpful and kind. They allowed me to preview the room for cleanliness. I probably should have mentioned that I had reserved a King bed, but I was so happy that the room was so clean and close to the office, that I let that error go.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff and next door availability of a great breakfast restaurant.
review.negativeRemarks: The only issue was I had reserved a King bed and the room I stayed in was only a Queen.

review.title: The worst hotel stay ever
review.reviewText: demolition of rooms..not advised when booking. and not able to get the correct room. no coffee in lobby.room was missing chairs and tables,no fresh towels or cleaning service.Cigarette smell all over non-smoking room we had.We had to go quite a distance to the front desk to pick up fresh towels.
review.negativeRemarks: everything
review.locationRemarks: close to most everthing

review.title: Not what I expected
review.reviewText: The only good thing about this hotel was the price; cheap. My fault I know you only get what you pay for. I was in a bind last minute going to SF and was arriving late in SF and had early am meeting. I thought I just need a bed for a few hours and decent shower. Its not that close to airport $38/cab ride no shuttle. Its renovated but I received on of the "NEW" rooms. The furniture was put together from scraps of other furniture, the windows would not lock (I was on the first floor), and so on. I would not stay here again even just to take a shower.

review.title: Totally fine for that price
review.reviewText: I just stayed here 2 nights and both nights I went to the room pretty late but it was all clean and good size of the room. The only thing disappointing was Wi-fi. They charge you $3/per 24hrs which is reasonable but seriously ? its 21st century and this hotel is right by the Silicon Valley where people think that sidewalks are made of IPADs :)
